issue.message: When targeting Android 13 or higher, posting a permission requires holding the `POST_NOTIFICATIONS` permission (usage from org.fossify.commons.asynctasks.CopyMoveTask)
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the `android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES` javadoc for details.

`@layout/activity_main` includes views not allowed in a `RemoteView`: androidx.coordinatorlayout.widget.CoordinatorLayout, androidx.viewpager.widget.PagerTabStrip, com.google.android.material.appbar.MaterialToolbar, org.fossify.commons.views.MyViewPager
Attribute `targetCellWidth` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 26)
Attribute `targetCellHeight` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 26)
The application should not provide its own launch screen
Avoid passing `null` as the view root (needed to resolve layout parameters on the inflated layout's root element)
A newer version of Gradle than 8.13 is available: 8.14.3
A newer version of com.android.application than 8.11.1 is available: 8.13.0. (There is also a newer version of 8.11.洧논 available, if upgrading to 8.13.0 is difficult: 8.11.2)
A newer version of `compileSdkVersion` than 34 is available: 36
Expecting `android:screenOrientation="unspecified"` or `"fullSensor"` for this activity so the user can use the application in any orientation and provide a great experience on Chrome OS devices
Fragment.isMenuVisible can only be called from within the same library group prefix (referenced groupId=`androidx.fragment` with prefix androidx from groupId=`Notes`)
Fragment.isMenuVisible can only be called from within the same library group prefix (referenced groupId=`androidx.fragment` with prefix androidx from groupId=`Notes`)

Fixed screen orientations will be ignored in most cases, starting from Android 16. Android is moving toward a model where apps are expected to adapt to various orientations, display sizes, and aspect ratios.
For locale "sk" (Slovak) the following quantity should also be defined: `many` (e.g. "10.0 d켿a")

This broadcast receiver declares an intent-filter for a protected broadcast action string, which can only be sent by the system, not third-party applications. However, the receiver's `onReceive` method does not appear to call `getAction` to ensure that the received Intent's action string matches the expected value, potentially making it possible for another actor to send a spoofed intent with no action string or a different action string and cause undesired behavior.
